p: In Vietnam progressive climate change will lead to increased temperatures and altering precipitation patterns, resulting in impacts such as rising sea levels, a higher probability of floods and droughts and more intense tropical cyclones [ 43, 44]. In 2016, Vietnam was in the top ten countries in regard to number of people affected by natural disasters [ 45]. This can impact upon agricultural production and rural livelihoods, for instance flooding has been found to affect arable land in Quang Nam province, Vietnam and impact up to 40% of wet rice production [ 46].
